comments.body: IMO this if block with `break` should be in the end of `while` block?

The reason I put the here is that there is that if the file size reaches threshold in the last run. It only flush to S3 once in https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/5663/files#diff-98426c5c739f27ea6aa369d3be536186R124.

Otherwise if we move the `break` in the end of `while` block, it got flush twice:
1. https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/5663/files#diff-98426c5c739f27ea6aa369d3be536186R143
2. https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/5663/files#diff-98426c5c739f27ea6aa369d3be536186R124

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +134,138 @@            if 'LastEvaluatedKey' not in response:
                # no more items to scan
                break

            last_evaluated_key = response['LastEvaluatedKey']
